title: Are Russian women really beautiful? - Quora

response.answer_text: Russian women are really beautiful. I give you examples of few famous Russian actresses, singers and models with their names so you can google additional pictures of them in the internet if you want. As you see Russians women have different faces, different age, different hair and eyes color and body shape  Famous Russian actress and movie director Renata Litvinova  Russian actress Natalia Selezneva in the comedy “Ivan Vasilievich Changing Profession”. In the film her husband, a genius engineer, built a time machine in his multifloor building apartment and mistakenly was transported, together with building superintendent Ivan Vasilievich, to the medieval Kremlin Palace in 1460 AD. Ivan Vasilievich: Back to the Future (1973) - IMDb  Famous Russian identical twins Olga and Tatiana Arntgolts. They are both very popular actresses  Actress Tatiana Arntgolts with her daughter  Famous singer Vera Brezhneva with her eldest daughter  Russian actress Lidya Fedoseeva-Shukshina  Famous Russian actress Maria Shukshina in different roles.  Actress Maria Sukshina with her older sons  Cheerleaders “Red Foxes”  Russian cheerleaders in Sochi Olympic Games  Russian actress Nonna Terentieva  Russian actress Irina Alferova  Russian actress Olga Fadeeva  Russian actress Polina Gagarina before and after diet  Russian actress Svetlana Chodchenkova before and after diet, she lost 20 kg  Russian actress Larisa Udovichenko in her youth and as an adult  Russian actress Anna Chipovskaya  Russian singer and porn star Anna Pletneva. She is married and a mother of 3 children.  Russian model Ekaterina Plekhova. Ekaterina was born in St. Petersburg on August 15, 1990. She won Miss St. Petersburg beauty contest in 2011 and has become a very popular model. Katya said that in her life the main thing is spiritual beauty, not external. But it seems in her case they are interconnected. During the Olympic Games in 2014, Catherine worked on the Olympic Committee.  Here I am. The beauty is very subjective concept, in the link below you can see the list of russian female actresses that considered as ‘ugly’ by Russian official standards. However they are still very good and popular actresses : Самые некрасивые актрисы России - фото

Good question comrade! Thank you for asking it! Yes, they are! Why? Natural Selection The Details: The USSR entered WWII after Hitler attacked it. The country was unprepared for a war, in part due to Stalin’s purges of the top military brass and a weak border. As we know, the Soviets lost a lot of territory, but they eventually started pushing the Germans back to Eastern Europe by 1944 and to Berlin by 1945. There was virtually no military assistance from the other allies (with the exception of Lend-Lease) as the British and Americans only opened a Western front in June 1944. This occurred when the Soviets were practically done with eliminating Germans from Soviet Territory and advancing into Eastern Europe. As a result, the main burden of the fighting in Europe rested with the Soviets. Consequently, the Soviets suffered horrific casualties. By a 2015 article published in Russia Insider, it is estimated that 23.8 million Soviets have died during WWII as a direct consequence of the war and Nazi occupation [In WWII the USSR Suffered Some 25.3 Million Dead]. Of course, most of these were men. Thus, there was a horrific loss of the male population with the women population not suffering to the same extent. This created a skewed sex ratio. As explained by a 2015 article published in Fact Tank, there was just 76.6 men per 100 women in Russia in 1950 [Why the former USSR has far fewer men than women]. There were less men to go around. Since polygamy was obviously not a big thing in European countries, it meant that if all approximately 77 men married a woman, there would be approximately 23 women left childless. Another factor that has led to a smaller number of men during the post-war years is traditional Russian alcoholism. Russians are famous for their drinking habits, and alcohol has been a major killer of men in Russia (as explained by a 2014 study published in The Lancet, a medical journal - Alcohol and mortality in Russia: prospective observational study of 151 000 adults). This led to even more men dying relative to women as more men tend to be alcoholics than women. I have now established that there was a shortage of men and a relatively large number of women during the post-war years. Of course since there was a shortage of men, the men got to pick and choose among the women, and the most beautiful women were quickly taken. This of course, resulted in their children having some of their “beautiful mother’s” genes and physically attractive features were passed on to the next generation. The intense competition among the Russian women to get a mate was exacerbated by the fact that there was a closed border, so no foreign men could take the remaining women. Therefore, those women who were less attractive were screwed and they did not have a mate. Looks do play a major role in the selection of a future mate. The ‘more beautiful’ women reproduced. The less ‘beautiful women’ did not. Sheer Darwinism. ~ Cheerio

hello, Why a relationship with a Russian woman might end in disappointment. 1. She is too beautiful for you All women are like women, but Russian women are like goddesses. Well, almost. Russian women's knockout beauty is one of the most widespread stereotypes about them. Although one must admit that the stereotype is not that far removed from reality – Russian women do pay an inordinate amount of time and attention to how they look. Wearing your stilettos to take the rubbish out? Putting on full makeup just to pop out to the shop? Yes, and why not? (We do, by the way, know why they do that). And yet, it is their boyfriends who will have to pay for all this beauty, both literally and figuratively speaking. You will be constantly outraged – and may become paranoid - at the persistent attention your girlfriend attracts from her admirers. Her dozens of bottles and jars on the bathroom shelf will very quickly crowd out your solitary antiperspirant and will eventually start falling on your head while you take your shower. Furthermore, a lady like that will be a constant source of worry, and from time to time you will have to fight over her (it could be with your fists or in Instagram comments, but you will have to). In other words, say goodbye to the quiet life. Everything depends on self-control, of course, but the temptation to land one day in the kitchen and never leave its cozy confines will only grow with time. The thing is that girls in Russian families are brought up from an early age to believe one pearl of wisdom: "The way to a man's heart is through his stomach." Simply put, this means that if you cook badly or too little, your boyfriend will leave you for the girl next door. No matter how you or your Russian girlfriend feels about these conventions from past centuries, one day she will try to surround you with a wall of pancakes (provided she is really into you anyway). You can be sure that everything will be done on a Russian scale. If she makes borsch, it will in a five-liter saucepan. If it is salad, there will be a basin of it. And if she roasts meat, there will be a full baking tray of it. And do not forget about her family. They remember "the stomach rule" too. A visit to your girlfriend's relatives will involve a lavish meal lasting at least three hours. I think you have already guessed that in addition to falling in love with your girlfriend you will also have to fall in love with Russian cuisine. All the more so since she is likely to measure your love for her by how selflessly and willingly you eat her food. 3. She will be difficult to get rid of… …if she has chosen you. Your Russian girlfriend will become your best friend, your partner, your doctor, your beauty consultant, psychologist and sparring partner. All your time now belongs to her, she thinks. Everything (really everything) will be sacrificed at the altar of your relationship. History remembers how in the 19th century Russian women followed their exiled husbands to Siberia. So do not expect that you will be able to scare your Russian girlfriend with hardship. If you start pretending to be hopeless, you will get even more care and emotional support. And after that, she will definitely not leave you. Never. Russian woman respects strength. Deep inside, she is independent, but even she does not always find this easy. Genetically, she is programmed – as noted by Russian writers back in tsarist times – "to enter a house on fire and to hold up a galloping horse." In the 21st century she can still find opportunities to show the strength of her character. For example, she will drag a 20-kg package of dog food up the stairs to the 10th floor and will not ask for help. Thanks,

Even though physical appearance perception differs based on the time and region, we can say that a common perception has formed nowadays thanks to the constantly developing communication tools and media etc. Given that our evaluation was conducted based on this common perception, here’s my theory about the formation period of the genetic features of Russian women whose beauty are considered as above the world standards. The population of the Soviet Union was 168 million when the 2nd World War broke out. We can assume that 84 million of this population was male. During this war, Soviet Union lost 23 million, which is the highest number. Casualty at this rate was equal to the 13% of the population at that time. This rate had never been seen in any other countries before the Second World War during the previous century. As you might have guessed, men between the ages of 18-30 form the vast majority of these casualties. Based on the population/age group statistics in the world, when we consider that the Soviet Union’s male population within this age group was around 15 million, we can say that there was almost no single and fertile men left in this country after the war. As a man usually marries one woman and has kids, it is very easy to estimate that there was a substantial increase in the number of marriable women for each man. From bacteria to humans, the common instinct for all creatures is to reproduce. This instinct forms the mate selection behavior in men. Men want to reproduce with beautiful women as beauty indicates health. Health is an indicator that the woman is fertile. A fertile woman means the continuity of the lineage. In this case, we can say that the few celibate men in the Soviet Union after the Second World War, only reproduced with the beautiful women. As a consequence, with the generation born between 1945-50 the genes related to beauty such as proper nose structure, tall height and legs etc. was carried over to the next generations and unattractive features went extinct in those years with the women who couldn’t marry. As a consequence, in modern societies each generation is born more beautiful than the previous but the catastrophes such as war during which men loss is quite high, might speed up this process.

Yes and no. And before someone gets angry, let me mention beforehand that this is all my opinion based on my perception of things, so hear me out… On average, Russia doesn't have more “pretty” women than any other country. They don't look more beautiful than women in any other Slavic country, with exception maybe being Czech Republic and Slovakia.  No, what Russia has are more women who “try to be pretty as possible”. An average Russian woman cares way more about her looks than average woman from western countries like Britain, from my experience. While yes, girls of other nations do that too, I believe in Russia it is more common. Many girls often use make-up and other cosmetics, braid their hair, dress in pretty dresses, clothes and fur coats to look incredibly fashionable and “doll-like”, because attractiveness and glamour has quite an importance to them. Some do it to keep up public image, some do it to be more attractive to opposite gender, some do it, because it makes them feel “beautiful etc. It is quite common that they do not like being seen in public in casual clothes without grooming themselves up.  This may create a perception of innate beauty of Russian women, even though it isn’t entirely true. If you want to see “natural beauty” of Russia, go to countryside or rural areas. There are girls and women in many forms. Gorgeous ones, pretty ones, average looking ones and ugly ducklings too. There are blue-eyed blondes, green eyed brunettes and brown eyed ones with dark hair, even redheads (though brown hair and blue or hazel eyes are probably the most common combination). This diversity is mainly caused by various ethnical makeup of current Russian population, which consists of many ethnical admixtures from Europe and non-European areas too.  And as was already mentioned, “beauty is in the eye of the beholder”. It all depends on your preference of phenotypes. Some find their oval/round facial features with perfectly straight hair, high cheekbones with graceful style very attractive, some do not. Russian girls are regarded as gorgeous for their looks and feminine behaviour in the West, but from what I’ve heard, many people in Baltic countries regard them as “slutty” or “cheap” for their superficiality. Though Nordic countries have stereotypes about Baltic women too, so it's all relative. Me? I consider them quite attractive, though I would wish for them to spend more time reading in the library than shopping at the mall. Physical beauty is not all that matters. Slavic girls, especially Central Slavic ones, will always take a good solid silver metal with some golden admixtures, on my list.  Unfortunately, I am bigger sucker for Norse women, which are gold stars, for me.

I, personslly encountered a Russian woman alive in some meeting which was arranged by one of our homegrown liftist political party. She was beautiful in a humanely way. The beauty I've seen in her was the perfect silence in her lips, with an intense sharpness. That lady when looked at me, it felt like I was being pierced by thousand knives at that very moment. She was white, may be she had got golden hair, like a princess from the goofy tale. ( because of my natural shyness, I couldn't see her properly, only glimpsed a bit over her). That woman had a very ‘dangerous beauty' in herself(may be I've seen her in that way) that she made me to feel a little coldness in my backbone. She was gorgeously dressed in a black dress. She had an innate humbleness in herself, though she arrogantly pulled her folded legs with the edge of her corner of that meeting table. She was nodding her head to every opinion we were making then. I only heard a single word from her mouth during that entire 3 hours long meeting. A Russian word, I seldom can recall that spell. But an unintelligible sound still happens in my ears, I suppose. I had made a mistake in a place of my opinion making, and sooner she pierced me with her those sharp eyes straight to my heart like nobody else yet did. I followed that silent correction. That was not warm firstly. But I've got a warm appreciaion too from those silent eyes, just after I baded sorry and corrected myself. May be I was killed with the brutality of her gorgeousness in every meaningful gesture. Or I may have been crashed by falling in love with her personality. Or maybe Russian womans have something in them! I don't know.

The answer is “no”, because the honest answer is - some of them are, some them are less so, but it is the matter of your taste, preferences, etc. And it applies to Russian people in general, not only women, because, I do not see a real point to somehow underline specifically Russian women, because, like in every other country, men and women share almost all of their typical physical features, even from the basic biology, there cannot be beautiful women without beautiful men, and vice versa. Russia is diverse country, with many ethnic groups, and appearance of people is also rather diverse. Most people who don’t live in Russia or are not very familiar with the country, usually make their opinions about Russian people from quite limited number of celebrities and small number of pictures circulating around the internet. In reality, celebrities and occasional pictures does not tell very much, how an average Russian person looks like. They can be very different looking people, both tall, short, stocky or slim, blond or dark, Asian-looking or completely European-looking. In Russia there is quite significant number of people, who pay very significant attention to their appearance. Does it always makes them beautiful? Well, depends on your taste, but for my liking they sometimes are trying too hard, to the point that there is too much cosmetics and shiny clothing to be attractive for me. But I am aware, that for somebody else it is exactly what they are looking for. At the same time, in deep country side in Russia you are also find men and women who look really modest. Or, in some worse cases, people of both genders who look terrible, because they do not care about their appearance very much, and also suffer from addictions. You would not call them even remotely beautiful. And their proportion in Russia is significantly larger than many other European countries, because Russia has relatively high income inequality, and it is by far less urbanized than most of the Europe.

And here again this question about the notorious "Russian beauty" ... Well, what can you say except that age-old stereotypes are not killed in a Western man. It's funny that all the beautiful East Slavic girls of the post-Soviet space (now it can belong to three separate countries: Belarus, Ukraine, Russia) are considered “Russian beauties”. In my opinion, Slavic ladies have always been distinguished by their pleasant appearance and soft feminine features. As a dating consultant, I have to deal with a large number of both Russian and Ukrainian girls, and there are many very attractive ones among them. But in truth, I did not notice any striking differences in the features of their appearance. Maybe because the most common and numerous is a mixed East Slavic phenotype with light brown hair and gray or blue eyes. I think that in the imagination of many western guys the “Russian beauty” is a kind of mythical image of a fair-haired blue-eyed ruddy shy girl with a thick long braid. But this fantastic character is hardly possible to meet in the modern city of Russia (except perhaps somewhere in a village in the outback). As far as I know, most modern Russian girls know how to style their hair beautifully and use make-up (sometimes even too much), dress nicely (glamorously), trying to emphasize the merits of their figure (which by the way are indisputable). But it is rather a feature not only of Russian, but of any modern Slavic woman in the post-Soviet space. Yes, I can confirm that among the Russian girls (at least among those I knew) there are a lot of really beautiful young women. And they are smart, educated and successful. But I’m not sure whether it is possible to say so about all Russian girls. Probably not. Just among Slavic women (especially young ones) there are really many delightful and simply attractive ones. As for the special beauty of Russian girls – so they are also mostly Slavic, and therefore they are no exception. I don’t know where this myth of the special "Russian beauty" came from, but I think there is a tangible truth in it. Although, external beauty isn’t the most important thing in our life.

I can’t speak for everyone, but I find Russian women attractive. And when I was a boy, I thought Russian girls were super attractive, too. I think it’s because it seems that Russian women, as a rule, have a “no fucks given” attitude. They always look like they’re tough as nails. And that doesn’t mean they look hard and beaten down. Some may look physically tough, and some look and dress feminine, be they of a hippie variety, a glammed-up clubbing variety, or any other look (I like ’em all). A Russian girl will dress however the fuck she wants. But even if they’re in flowing peasant dresses, or in five inch heels, or wearing overalls and a thin coat in a photo as they bunker down during the Siege of Stalingrad, I feel like there’s never anything “soft” about them. Russian girls don’t usually smile, though sometimes they cackle with delight when you fuck up—though if you do fuck up, they won’t tolerate it for long. A Russian girl won’t tell you that your clothes look wrinkled, she’ll say they look like they were “pulled out of an elephant’s ass.” They’ll tell you exactly what they think, and they’ll do what the fuck they want. A Russian girl will always jump the turnstiles if no one is watching. A Russian girl will steal the salt and pepper shakers from a restaurant for you if you tell her you like them. A Russian girl once propositioned me for sex right in front of her boyfriend, a young, tough guy who had assaulted people with a baseball bat for the Russian Mafia, because he didn’t speak English and couldn’t understand what was happening (I didn’t accept—not because I was scared of the boyfriend, but because I was a virgin and deathly afraid of what forceful pleasures this woman would try to extract from my timid body). Russian girls are fucking tough. That’s not to say that all Russian women are the same. No two women, just like no two people, are the same. And I’m sure there are some timid, non-stealing Russian gals who would never cheat on their mafia boyfriends. I did once have a Russian girlfriend who was a super happy, joyous woman who would never want to hurt anyone’s feelings and who, on the surface, might seem to contradict some of the above. But admittedly, she moved out of Russia when she was like 8 years old. And she was tough in her own way. She was never afraid to speak her mind, never afraid to do something crazy (she started a whole organization in Los Angeles to basically exploit a law allowing you to steal fruit from people’s property if it hangs from a tree—an “urban fruit harvesting project”), and when she kind of forgot how fragile American men could be sometimes, she might accidentally say something like “Yeah, but Dan, you know you’re going to be late and fuck all that up, right?” Last time I saw her, long after we’d just become friends, I visited her in Brighton, England, and I nearly missed my train back to London because she refused to let me buy a multi-pack of glue for my shoe and insisted I keep looking until I found a single pack—and I did keep looking for the single pack. I couldn’t not keep looking, because Russian girls are tough! (If you’re reading this, I love you, Vera! Please don’t kill me!) And also, things might have changed a bit since I was a younger man: most of my knowledge of Russian girls comes from a time when all Russian girls remembered the Soviet Union and the hardships that followed, whereas there are full-blown Russian women now who have never known a pre-Glasnost life. The Russian people once had to fend for themselves largely by stealing utilities from their own corrupt government and trading goods on the black market. All that may have changed, and so too their attitudes. I hope not. It’s a weird thing, because I’ve been to Russia, and I have seen some of the worst sexism from men against women that I’ve ever seen in my life. Of course, this was the 1990s, when work was scarce. But I’d literally see Russian men stay home and smoke cigarettes all day, and the women would go to work, come home, and then cook and clean and wait on the men hand and foot while they hung out in their t-shirts and underwear! This was when Yeltsin was in charge, and when he went public in an interview saying there was some little Russian pan-fried five minute recipe he liked to make for himself, it was a big deal—like “hey guys, you can be manly and not make your wife cook everything! This is a turning point in Russian feminism!” I even saw this at a Russian friend’s house in Oklahoma when I was in high school—she was at her house and her father and younger brother were both in their T-shirts and underwear, sitting around the table, as she served them iced tea and wiped up their crumbs! It was one one of the worst one-sided scenarios between men and women I’ve ever seen in a culture that wasn’t a theocracy. And it made even less sense to me in a culture that had pioneered adding women to the workforce, a culture that had female engineers and plumbers and professors and taxi drivers and soldiers long before the rest of the world. (Maybe this is why my friend don’t give a fuck about propositioning me in front of her boyfriend—maybe Russian boyfriends are tools). So, I guess what I’m saying is that I must be a prejudiced bastard, who thinks Russian women are all a certain way, when they’re not. You really should do your own legwork on this. But that said… if you’re like most men, hetero or not, or even like most people of any gender, I think you probably respect women who aren’t pushovers. And Russian women, at least the young single women I’ve met, are the least pushover-est women I’ve met. In fact, if you want to see a pushover, be near a tough Russian girl, stand near an embankment, and then just do something really stupid. She’ll show you the meaning of pushing someone over!

Not all Russian women are, but I see what you mean. A lot of the ones we see advertised are lean with high cheekbones and long healthy hair. There are a few reasons, along with the genetic theory that others have presented: They eat less packaged food and more natural food. Russians eat more vegetables and walk more than we do. Restaurants and fast food just hasn’t been a thing there like it is here in America.It is acceptable to tell a Russian person they look fat or unattractive, thus no one wants to be called out - i.e. social shaming.It is okay to be sexy in Russia. A lot of American women feel like we have to choose between “successful” or “sexy”, and to be taken seriously, we have to look more conservative and turn down the sex appeal.Even their alcohol has less calories. Vodka is the low calorie dieters choice and Americans drink a lot of beer which is the opposite.There are beautiful women everywhere, but the American diet and lifestyle caters to convenience and mass production. We eat a lot of chemicals that should not be consumed and get less exercise (walking) than we should. This definitely doesn’t apply to everyone, but it’s a trend. We have to look out for ourselves no matter where we live. Eat natural foods, get exercise, sleep well and enjoy life.

There’s like 180 ethnicites in Russia, did you have one in mind? This woman is from Russia  So’s this one:  And her:  There will always be a preponderance of pictures of attractive people versus unattractive, so an internet search won’t do you much good in getting an idea of averages. That being said, especially if you’re in a 1st-world Western country, they tend to be thinner. There’s more pressure to be attractive, to land a husband, and to have a family. They tend to work harder in the home and walk more often. Eventually, the so-called “Babushka bomb” catches up to a lot them. But I think that’s mostly a product of a lifetime of stress and eventually slowing down when the kids start moving out. Comfort and luxury aren’t as easy to come by, but some do age breath-takingly:  Honestly, when I look at this woman, I get the sense that physical attractiveness is directly impacted by happiness and joy over time. (I’m sure good genes help, too.) I’ve seen some hideous “beautiul” women and lovely “plain” women. But I’m absolutely certain she would not be nearly as beautiful were she not as loved as she seems in these photographs:  Russian Photographer Captures Beautiful Elderly Couple To Show That Love Transcends Time (So worth your time to view.)

As a central European mixed with Middle Eastern I find both the women and men extremely unattractive. I think they are just overrated by men who are inexperienced and who can't tell virgin from slut. I find them pretty gross and they have psychopaths among them and are just really retarded too. I do not really see why anyone would be jealous either. I have been dumped before for Russian woman and many people I know have but I am sorry I just don't see it. This is my opinion as a bisexual… I just wouldn't sleep with them if I were a guy and I find men who sleep with them turn unattractive too. Maybe it's why their men are so ugly too. They sleep with these women and after they do they turn into monsters. Their choice and loss. I just can't understand. I hope to marry someone at least attractive in the future. I dated an English guy who was extremely handsome and after he cheated on me with a couple of women he turned into exhausted. I have no idea what they did to him. It is why I just don't respect nor like Russian women anymore. It is just all fake. As a virgin I prefer guys who don't sleep with russian women or women with high body count as I just find Russian women gross. It is the truth and I can't lie. I think when you are not cheated on you don't maybe think of this but after you get cheated on and see these women naked who are not very sexy you realise that is not what you want. I have dated some women but they were ok. Russian women just put me off women and men in general. Sad really. Also they are jealous, petty and dangerous people. Their men seem like cruel womanbeaters and the women seem like cruel manbeaters too. Not interested. Thanks. Next. :) I think it may simply be superficial glib and like some other women they lie a lot to homewreck others. I also don't advise getting involved with someone who dates them as it saves you from a bit of drama and serious health issues… I have grieved the loss now so I don't care about what these people say or do anymore. Hating on me just doesn't work. I am immune to bs now.

Not especially. Much of this is hype. Beautiful women are found everywhere. This is not to say beauties from this part of the world don't exist, because they do! But many, many Russians and Ukrainians are fairly similar-looking to other nationalities in the north of Europe. The PERCEPTION that they are "so" beautiful, “different”, or "exceptionally" beautiful can be put down to 2 reasons. Reason 1. Some Russian women take exceptional interest and pride in their appearance. This, of course, is a generalisation as there are Ukrainian and Russian women I know that are not that focused on physical appearances, as their families, intellect, studies, inner beauty, or work — takes priority. But for others, it is like a passion to look their best for men, and to be considered "beautiful". This always groomed and fashionably-dressed cliche is certainly the image put across on copious dating sites advertising the advantages of having a Russian wife or girlfriend. That plays a huge role — huge! Reason 2. They more closely fit the extremely widespread but quite racially narrow stereotype of what a supposedly "beautiful woman" is: white, thin, often blonde, etc. This kind of woman is what white Western media promotes everywhere as the most beautiful and desirable of women. Essentially this stereotype is what is behind the hype.

Well, look at me. Aren’t I beautiful? I am Russian.The truth is - beauty is in the eye of beholder. What is attractive to one, may be ugly to another. Compared to the United States, Canada and The Great Britain that I had many opportunities to visit, Russia is very full of beauties. Truly, women wear high heels and stylish clothes even if they just need to take garbage out. Women in Russia are like those in Texas - they like their makeup. It was difficult for me to get out without putting on the smoky eyes. Living in Seattle made me a bit more relaxed and, possibly, less beautiful - but that depends on who is looking.Women in Russia walk a lot. When you walk instead of driving, what happens? Right, you get a workout. Women compete for men. There are more ladies than gentlemen in Russia, so, you’ve got to keep up with your rivals to grab a man to play house with. That is another reason why women like to look better. Overall, I think, the looks matter more in Russia for that one particular reason: after the Great Patriotic War and the WW2 we were simply left with NOT ENOUGH MEN. So, until today we are in the race.

I would say without a doubt it is true and not another generalization. I have been to Russia about 25 times. I have dated lots of Russian women and have been happily married to one for nearly a decade. I am not saying every Russian woman is beautiful. They have their share of average and below average looking women however there are more beautiful women as a percentage of the population and the many that are beautiful are stunning. There is another edge that I will give to Russian women. By and large they have the best bodies in the world. No ifs ands or buts. Perhaps it comes from eating more fruits and veggies and fewer Big Mac’s or perhaps it is because they walk much more than American women but nearly all the women are built nicely even ones in their 30’s and 40’s. They can also be very warm and caring but do sometimes come off as blunt. Part of that comes in differences in the language and part that they are more direct in what they say. They basically say what they mean. They also can be very strong willed. Russia is much more competitive than the USA.

We seem to be in double mind about beauty of our women. Officially, we claim that our women are the most beautiful in the world. When it comes to artistic and personal choices, however, we often tend to go for alternatives. Just three prime examples of the uncertainty we feel: The face of the Motherland on the gigantic WW2 monument in Volgograd is of an Armenian woman Ekaterina Arkelovna Gevorkyan. 2. The face of the cute Slavic girl Alenka on the wrapping of the iconic Soviet (now Russian) chocolate bar (Шоколад Алёнка) belongs to Jewish girl Elena Gerinas.  3. President Putin’s alleged paramour is a Tatar athlete Alina Kabayeva, who has very pronounced Turkic facial traits. Putin’s detractors quip that the many facelifts Putin himself has taken made now himself look like a white Mongol.

Eastern Eurpean culture are very concerned about appearance, also lack some western stereotypes.Taking care of their looks are not view as shallow.Looks attractive is not view as being wanting a man or being inferior to a men.Half a century of communism make Christian values not important in their culture, sexuality is not reason for shame.
